origin_of_ch_char_book: The first born son had a privilege as the inheritor of the parentsâ€™ family fortune. In return, the oldest son was responsible for the ceremonies of ancestors and parents. With such privilege, the eldest son had power over his younger siblings. Therefore, the eldest son often ordered his younger siblings around. (å…„, xiong=hsiung, elder brother) describes elder brother, which combines a (å£, kou, mouse) and a person (äºº, ren, human). Together, they symbolize â€œa person who speaks or gives ordersâ€. If the spirit tablet or altar (ç¤º, shi=shih, show) is added to the left , (ç¥, zhu, wish), it means the eldest brother who represents the group praying or calling a blessing from God. Then, how can the younger brother be depicted? The creator(s) of Hanzi thought about the sequence of brothers. The character (å¼Ÿ, di, younger brother) shows a spear in the middle (æˆˆ), and a rope winding the spear (). The reason for winding the spear is to prevent slippage and to make sure the spear will not break. This character came to mean â€œyounger brotherâ€ because of the meaning of winding order, or sequence. When you wind a rope around the spear, you have to do it in an orderly way. Therefore, it symbolizes the order in the ages of the siblings.
humanum_full_description_en:
Jia Jinwen starts from " mouth " from " person ", it means that people can open their mouths to speak. In ancient times, the elder brother was the person who gave orders and had the responsibility of supervising the brothers (Shen Pei), so the word " brother " followed "å£" is a sign. The original meaning is brother. "Said Wen": "Brother, Chang Ye. From the child to the mouth. All brothers belong to the brother."

In Jiajin inscriptions, the shape of fingers may be drawn in the shape of " person " from " brother ", which is similar to the shape of " long ", " old ", " kao ", etc., which are often written over the hand, to indicate that the elder brother is older People: It is said that the " brother " in the form of covering the hand may be the initial ideogram of the " bun " that expresses the reward. Because there are many kinds of rewards, it is not drawn, and only the hand shape is emphasized to indicate the action of award. Shen Pei believes that the " brother " in the form of a hand-covered hand is not only a variant of the elder brother's " brother ", but also an initial ideogram of " Ben ".

Later, the " mouth "-shaped horizontal pen runs through the left and right vertical pens, which are similar to the " twenty " shape. Or add " ğ¡‰š " (" to ") as the sound note . Or add the meaning of " person ".

In addition, pay attention to the distinction between the ancient characters "ç¥" and " brother ". The difference between the character " brother " and the character "ç¥" which does not follow the " show " is that the figure of " brother " is standing, while the figure of "ç¥" in the early days is kneeling (Yao Xiaosui).

The oracle bone inscription is used as the original meaning to indicate that the elder brother is the object of sacrifice. "Compilation" 2870: "ã¢(yor) elder brother Jia", which means yor sacrifice to the elder brother. Bronze inscriptions are also used as the original meaning to mean elder brother, Wang Sun's survivor Zhong: "Guest father and brother with music" means to entertain guests and father and elder brother. Qi Houpin: "Brother Baowu". It is also used as "è´¶", which means a reward, to make a booklet. Yi: "Ling Zha (zuo) Chuzhe's brother (è´¶) Wang Tu Yuxianghou". "Zuoshu" is the official name, which refers to the booklet and is responsible for the documents The historian of records. " Zhe " is the name of a person, and "Wang Tu" is the land of Wang Di, which means that a booklet is ordered to give Wang Di to the lords. The Chinese tripod: "Brother Jin (è´¶) ç•€you ä™åœŸ, make a nai Cai." "è´¶ç•€" is synonymous with the word "giving", which means that the land given to you now is your favorite. "Er Ya. "Explanation": "Ben, thanks."

The difference between " Ben " and " Give " is that " Ben " refers to the transfer of rewards, and " Give " refers to the gift from the top to the bottom, and no one transfers it (Peng Yushang).

The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period are also used as the original meaning, referring to the older brother, "Shangbo Bamboo Book IV. "Neifeng" Jane 4: "In ancient times, those who are brothers and speakers cannot be merciful (brother), and those who are not the same as the elder brothers cannot be acquainted (brother) "It means that if you are a elder brother, you should talk about your brotherâ€™s inability to be kind to your brother, and donâ€™t talk about your brotherâ€™s failure to accept your brother (Ji Xusheng).
humanum_short_description_en: The meaning of the people of the Jiajingwenhui who speak openly. In ancient times, the elder brother was the commander and had the responsibility of supervising the younger brothers, so he used the " mouth ". The original meaning is brother.

The character (å¼Ÿ, di, younger brother) shows a spear in the middle (æˆˆ), and a rope winding the spear (). The reason for winding the spear is to prevent slippage and to make sure the spear will not break. Jia Jinwen starts from " mouth" from " person", it means that people can open their mouths to speak. In ancient times, the elder brother was the person who gave orders and had the responsibility of supervising the brothers (Shen Pei), so the word " brother" followed " å£" is a sign. The original meaning is brother. "Said Wen": "Brother, Chang Ye. From the child to the mouth. All brothers belong to the brother." In Jiajin inscriptions, the shape of fingers may be drawn in the shape of " person" from " brother", which is similar to the shape of " long", " old", " kao", etc., which are often written over the hand, to indicate that the elder brother is older People: It is said that the " brother" in the form of covering the hand may be the initial ideogram of the " bun" that expresses the reward. Because there are many kinds of rewards, it is not drawn, and only the hand shape is emphasized to indicate the action of award. Shen Pei believes that the " brother" in the form of a hand-covered hand is not only a variant of the elder brother's " brother", but also an initial ideogram of " Ben". Later, the " mouth"-shaped horizontal pen runs through the left and right vertical pens, which are similar to the " twenty" shape. Or add " ğ¡‰š" (" to") as the sound note. Or add the meaning of " person". In addition, pay attention to the distinction between the ancient characters " ç¥" and " brother". The difference between the character " brother" and the character " ç¥" which does not follow the " show" is that the figure of " brother" is standing, while the figure of " ç¥" in the early days is kneeling (Yao Xiaosui). The oracle bone inscription is used as the original meaning to indicate that the elder brother is the object of sacrifice. "Compilation" 2870: "ã¢(yor) elder brother Jia", which means yor sacrifice to the elder brother. Bronze inscriptions are also used as the original meaning to mean elder brother, Wang Sun's survivor Zhong: "Guest father and brother with music" means to entertain guests and father and elder brother. Qi Houpin: "Brother Baowu". It is also used as " è´¶", which means a reward, to make a booklet. Yi: "Ling Zha (zuo) Chuzhe's brother (è´¶) Wang Tu Yuxianghou". "Zuoshu" is the official name, which refers to the booklet and is responsible for the documents The historian of records. " Zhe" is the name of a person, and "Wang Tu" is the land of Wang Di, which means that a booklet is ordered to give Wang Di to the lords.
